Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: The only identified source is a press release describing the deployment of a GenAI chatbot with oversight by human team members. While this demonstrates some human involvement in AI operations, it lacks details on formal oversight structures, committees, or appeals processes.

sourcesUsed.title: Target to Roll Out Transformative GenAI Technology to its Store Team Members Chainwide
sourcesUsed.summary: Press release announcing Store Companion GenAI chatbot deployment with human team member oversight and operational management.

summary.overallFindings: Target Corporation currently provides minimal public evidence of responsible AI practices across all seven pillars. Only one source, a press release on GenAI deployment, demonstrates some human oversight, but lacks detail on formal structures or accountability. There is no public documentation addressing transparency, fairness, explainability, privacy, governance, or external commitments. Overall, Target's responsible AI disclosures are significantly below industry best practices.
